title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing one way that Image 1 illustrates the concept of intensive agriculture.

Two points for describing two ways that Image 1 illustrates the concept of intensive agriculture.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following ways that Image 1 illustrates the concept of intensive agriculture:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways that Image 1 illustrates the concept of intensive agriculture:
The response correctly describes two of the following ways that Image 1 illustrates the concept of intensive agriculture:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the Green Revolution led to higher yields of potatoes due to new technologies.

Two points for explaining how the Green Revolution led to higher yields of potato crops.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the Green Revolution led to higher yields of potato crops:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the Green Revolution led to higher yields of potato crops:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the Green Revolution led to higher yields of potato crops:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that more traditional agricultural practices use lower levels of pesticide and fertilizer.

Two points for explaining why traditional agricultural practices are associated with lower levels of pesticide and fertilizer use.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following :
The response correctly explains one of the following :
The response correctly explains one of the following :

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that mixed crop farming minimizes the risk of a crop failure.

Two points for fully explaining a reason why mixed crop farming may be economically advantageous to farmers.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which the practice of mixed crop farming may be economically advantageous to farmers:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the practice of mixed crop farming may be economically advantageous to farmers:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the practice of mixed crop farming may be economically advantageous to farmers:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that farms can be linked to larger markets through complex commodity chains when they sell their crops.

Two points for explaining how small family farms can integrate into complex commodity chains, and/or explaining a specific effect that this integration may have on small farms.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that small family farms growing potatoes in developing countries can be integrated into a complex commodity chain:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that small family farms growing potatoes in developing countries can be integrated into a complex commodity chain:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that small family farms growing potatoes in developing countries can be integrated into a complex commodity chain:
